long_desc.thetext:
(In reply to comment #1) > Do I understand correctly: > salesOrder.setCustomer(customer); > // at this point salesOrder is CLEAN and customer is TRANSIENT Correct > resource.getContents().add(customer);
> // at this point customer becomes NEW but the above reference is not > adjusted???
Correct.. but it should be adjusted only after the commit ... right ?
This problem probably occured because of the revision delta. Before CDORevisionImpl.writeValue was taking care of changing the value to a CDOID.
Created attachment 86215 TestCase
I will come up with a patch.
This will be really useful !! Thank you to let me know.

My first thought to fix that bug was to add a visitor... but I cannot use the delta to adjust CDOID since indexes provided for list modification are not necessarly good. And I don't want to calculate the index of an object .... to convert it.
What do you think if I do the following:
revision.adjustReferences(idMappings, CDOIDProvider ); I will do it in one pass.
or
revision.adjustReferences(CDOIDProvider); ? I will do it in two passes... but it has better design.
For both cases I have no choice to do it in the CommitTransition.
Before it was already in two phases... (writeValues + adjustReferences).

The third solution could be using deltas for Set :
and for collection... if something changed... I will go through the list.
I will do my conversion not at committransition but when I call writeRevisionDeltas.

Created attachment 86252 Idea of a solution
I guess the "only" problem is with list changes where indices of additions can be altered by subsequent changes. What about reconstructing the actual indices from the feature deltas?
I've attached a patch with a design proposal. It's untested, especially the implementations of IListIndexAffecting.reconstruct()!!!
I was unser how to get a handle to the related revision from within a feature delta. Why don't the feature deltas have a back pointer to their revision delta? Could we add that? Then we could query getID() and think about how to get the revision from the id...

(In reply to comment #11) > Created an attachment (id=86252) [details] > Idea of a solution > I guess the "only" problem is with list changes where indices of additions can > be altered by subsequent changes. What about reconstructing the actual indices > from the feature deltas? > I've attached a patch with a design proposal. It's untested, especially the > implementations of IListIndexAffecting.reconstruct()!!! > I was unser how to get a handle to the related revision from within a feature > delta. Why don't the feature deltas have a back pointer to their revision > delta? Could we add that? Then we could query getID() and think about how to > get the revision from the id...
What I don't like with this solution is the fact where you will need to create an array of the number of element... I want to stay away from there since is use memory for nothing... and an array of 10 millions elements... isn't really good to have. Even with your solution, you will go through the index more time than one to adjust you indexes. In my case I go through it only one. I still prefer my solution... for the future and performance.
What do you think ?
I want also to remove the fact that we create under CDORevision an array of the real number of elements...and we uninitailized them... It shouldn't be like that.

(In reply to comment #12) > What I don't like with this solution is the fact where you will need to create > an array of the number of element... I want to stay away from there since is use > memory for nothing... and an array of 10 millions elements... isn't really good > to have. Even with your solution, you will go through the index more time than > one to adjust you indexes. In my case I go through it only one. I still prefer > my solution... for the future and performance. My solution doesn't scale with the number of refs in the revision list but rather with the number of changes within that transaction/commit. I think inserting 10 millions of refs in a single commit is an exception but even in this case my approach should scale appropriate.
> I want also to remove the fact that we create under CDORevision an array of the > real number of elements...and we uninitailized them... It shouldn't be like that. This seems to be another discussion and we should discuss it in the newsgroup until we decide to open a bug. Recently I got quite confused with some bug discussions and the related CVS commits ;-(

> My solution doesn't scale with the number of refs in the revision list but > rather with the number of changes within that transaction/commit.
To be sure we understand each other correctly.
indices.length == number of element in you list ? Right ?
No, exactly the number of *added* refs. The indices list will only grow for feature deltas that implement IListTargetAdding, that is CDOAddFeatureDeltaImpl and CDOSetFeatureDeltaImpl.

(In reply to comment #14) > > My solution doesn't scale with the number of refs in the revision list but > > rather with the number of changes within that transaction/commit. > To be sure we understand each other correctly. > indices.length == number of element in you list ? Right ?
OK.. I understand now.. sorry. indices.length == number of change in the list.
Yes it is a good idea.
I would like to try to keep writing and adjustReference separately... I really don't like the fact that we do some processing in the serialization. Only Commit will need to do that, Right ? It is why I see it more with an Visitor approach. If you think it could be use somewhere else...
Also, when we will use this feature to serialize from server to client... we don't need to this this.

(In reply to comment #16) > Yes it is a good idea. Fine!
I must admit that I'm struggling a bit with the correct implementation of the reconstruct() methods ;-( My mind is shaking when reversing exemplary deltas. I'll attach my latest approach with TC as a patch.
> I would like to try to keep writing and adjustReference separately... > I really don't like the fact that we do some processing in the serialization. > Only Commit will need to do that, Right ? Right. I also see it like a consession to performance and scalability. May be, after we managed to develop a correct version we're able to factor the algorithm out of the feature deltas and use it from commit in a scalable manner...
> It is why I see it more with an > Visitor approach. If you think it could be use somewhere else... Not at the moment but since, as a visitor, it should be isolated we shouldn't throw it away. I can commit it anyway, may be as deprecated.
> Also, when we will use this feature to serialize from server to client... we > don't need to this this. I've already factored out the mechanism into a separate method so that we can simply switch it on or not.
Created attachment 86254 Solution v2

Do you mind if I put this code in the visitor I already created ? Instead of going through the list like before I will simply do the optimize way.
I don't want to scrap the delta design by addind CDORevision in the Delta when it doesn't need that to exist. If someone from us come up with something that we are sure of .. we could put it inside.
Created attachment 86257 Solution v3 - with visitor

Created attachment 86258 Solution v3
This one works already for CDOAddFeatureDeltaImpls
Midair collision ;-) Good that you named your version other than just v3!

(In reply to comment #22) > Midair collision ;-) > Good that you named your version other than just v3!
:-)
Stupid question.
How can getIndex for CDOAddFeatureDelta could be at NO_INDEX ?
Usually after the client called add(Object) instead of add(int, Object). At least I always believed that...

(In reply to comment #24) > Usually after the client called add(Object) instead of add(int, Object). At > least I always believed that...
Not based on the documentation. EMF will take care of putting it at the end.
get index - an index within the content or InternalEObject.EStore.NO_INDEX.
add index - an index within the content.
source http://help.eclipse.org/help32/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.emf.doc/references/javadoc/org/eclipse/emf/ecore/class-use/InternalEObject.EStore.html

(In reply to comment #25) I remembered from my previous CDO implementation where a ChangeRecorder was used. There I had to deal with NO_INDEX values. Maybe that it's not necessary here, but it's easy to protect against list impl bugs.

You didn't reply to the following from comment #8:
I was unsure how to get a handle to the related revision from within a feature delta. Why don't the feature deltas have a back pointer to their revision delta? Could we add that? Then we could query getID() and think about how to get the revision from the id...

(In reply to comment #28) > You didn't reply to the following from comment #8: > I was unsure how to get a handle to the related revision from within a feature > delta. Why don't the feature deltas have a back pointer to their revision > delta? Could we add that? Then we could query getID() and think about how to > get the revision from the id...
Did you look at the solution v3 with visitor ? and my comments #19.
It answer your question by putting this feature as a visitor. I didn't want to put to much responsability to CDORevisionDelta... when it is not his job to do the conversion.
Let me know what you think.

Your patch has many conflicts now that I committed the index reconstruction work. Can you create a new patch please? I also prefer to have the adjustment of the revisions not in the deltas. The adjustment of the delta itself should stay there, ok?

Created attachment 86263 Solution v4 - with visitor
With your latest changes I kept the adjustment of the delta in the delta. I put adjustment of the revisions in the visitor.
CDOFeatureHandler isn't needed anymore but didn't remove it.
Let me know what you think.

Created attachment 86264 Solution v5
This new patch just contains cleanup. I like the visitor version but I can't commit it so far because BugzillasTest still fails ;-(

How the bugzilla test is working ? How can I runned them ?
I passed cdotest cases and it passes.
It's in org.eclipse.emf.cdo.tests.BugzillasTest.java
Committed to CVS
BTW. I moved the content of former BugzillasTest into RevisiondeltaTest

Created attachment 86460 Need to handle clear
Test case to show the problem. and the patch to fix the problem.

Created attachment 86461 Handle clear v2
More optimize solution
Committed Clear Patch v2 Thank you!
cleanup
